title: publish/push should automagically "annex export" instead of "annex copy" to the special remote configured for export

labels.name: severity-important
labels.description: major effect on the usability of a package, without rendering it completely unusable to everyone

body:
ignorant me thought that annex export happens automagically upon "annex copy" if remote is configured with `exporttree=yes`. [Apparently](https://git-annex.branchable.com/git-annex-export/) and unfortunately it is not the case and it requires use of dedicated `annex export BRANCH` command to export the tree to such special remote.  I think we could/should simplify publishing to the "exported" special remotes by calling `annex export` (not copy) if the annex special remote has exporttree configured.  The possible gotcha (I didn't work with exported remotes much) is confusion if export is attempted from different branches.

BTW -- here is a sample code to produce/export to such  special rsync remote:
```shell
datalad create /tmp/testds; cd /tmp/testds; echo 123 > 123; datalad add 123 && \
  git annex initremote rsync-remote type=rsync rsyncurl=localhost:/tmp/testds-rsync encryption=none exporttree=yes && \
  git annex export --to=rsync-remote master && \
  ls -l /tmp/testds-rsync 
```
